intro: Tetranthera lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly tetranthera, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. Tetranthera lanuginosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas.
